intro: Rangaeris biglandulosa, commonly known as the hairy-leaved rangaeris, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its showy, pinkish-white flowers. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in shaded areas within forests. Rangaeris biglandulosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
